CommentBody:
External storage does not reach the server.
SMTP TSL 1.3 fails the handshake.

On Escalation Ticket # 00412430 the new comment has been added: Andrei Pop:

The customer asks if there is an update regarding this.

[DevOps CommentId:10547450]

On Escalation Ticket # 00412430 the new comment has been added: Oana-Cristina Rus:

Have you checked if port 587 is blocked or not?

Have you tested the SMTP with an internal email address? I want to make sure that no firewall blocks emails from being sent.
Did you receive the success message when you checked the sent test email and saved the settings?

--- CODE ---
Changes have been saved! A test email was sent to xxx
--- CODE ---
Your email settings may be incorrect if you don't get this message.

[DevOps CommentId:10566055]

[DevOps CommentId:10612556]

On Escalation Ticket # 00412430 the new comment has been added: Hello,
587 is not blocked as the customer was able to send the test email when using the Outlook legacy option.
With or without TLS 1.3 authentication the test email is not sent.
Witn TLS 1.3 authentication the message appears but the email is not sent.

On Escalation Ticket # 00412430 the new comment has been added: Oana-Cristina Rus:

Hi @WaitingOnEngineer,


As product team confirmed on this case, TLS 1.3 improvements were implemented in 5.9.2.0 release and is successfully tested by our QA and hundreds of customers (Jira:).So for sure this is SMTP configuration/routing issue on customer side. Issue should be resolved by their SMTP support team or provider.
Thank you

We have connected again with the customer and they fix their SMTP configuration, they are receiving email from other tests, but they are not receiving fro EPP server. 

We have tried to recreate the mailer folder which has been automatically deleted after a couple of seconds. 

Restarted the services and verified in the /var/mail/root , that there were some errors regarding the email address that the user is using.

We changed that address and the test mail is not received . 

I have attached a screenshot with the error found.

On Escalation Ticket # 00412430 the new comment has been added: Hello,

We had a new remote session with the customer and there are a few connection timeout received on the /var/log/mail.log with their relay. 

They investigated and concluded that this is due to an invalid hostname that is sending the email (root@eppserver) which is blocked by the Microsoft security.

Is there a way to change the address from our end ?

On Escalation Ticket # 00412430 the Following Fields have been updated: 
Status has been changed to Awaiting Escalating Engineer.

On Escalation Ticket # 00412430 the new comment has been added: Oana-Cristina Rus:

Hi,

Starting with the 5940 version an issue was added "326369  Issue with triggering Alerts - the "From" email address needs to be changed".

This modification will be applied only for email alternative transport.
Added a checkbox to enable the use of a custom sender and a custom sender email input to be displayed when TLS 1.3 is checked on System Settings --> E-mail server Settings or e-mail configuration wizard.
If the checkbox to enable the custom sender is checked and a custom email is provided, then the 'From' attribute will have the provided custom email address.
If the checkbox to enable the custom sender is not checked or if the checkbox is checked but the custom sender address is not provided, then the 'From' attribute will have root@eppserver (in our case).
The No-reply email address option will be hidden when TLS 1.3 is checked.

Note:
Depending on the organization's Anti-spam filter policy, using a custom sender for alternative transport may cause the emails to be labeled as Phishing or Spam and sent to Quarantine.
The usage of a system service to send emails will still set root@eppserver (in our case) as the sender in mail.log and email headers because it is normal behavior. The provided custom sender address will be used only for the email "From" header.




If you want to use this issue, please talk to the customer and try to upgrade the EPP version from 5930 to 5940.



@WaitingOnEngineer

On Escalation Ticket # 00412430 the new comment has been added: Hello, 

We had a remote session today with the customer and performed the following steps: 

- clear the email settings information save it  and tried to send a test email. was not working since they have the tls 1.3 enabled and configured.
- add all the information manually and test, the test email was not working. 
- changed the port from 587 to 25 and then to 465 none of them were working
- the message that the email is sent is present but the email is not received.
- they verified and add in their Microsoft Exchange the *endpointprotector.com to be whitelisted
- there is no blocking from their side
- we checked the mail.log file where the message first says that is being sent, then errors like " unable to qualify my own domain name (eppserver)" -- using short name 
- i have attached multiple screenshots with the errors
- upgrade the EPP server version to 5.9.4.1 and redo the configuration no email was received
- the same config is working on the smtp test tool URL which is sending them a test email 
- perform a reboot to the EPP server 
- the customer is mentioning that root@eppserver is not a normal user and that why they are not receiving the emails 
- before I started the steps from the procedure no.6 Changing the E-mail Server address and display name , a test email was received, which I have notice it after I performed the steps. 
- re add the old settings didn't created any new test emails
- pinged their relay was working 

Could you please check internally and let us know when we can schedule a new session with them, in which some one from R&D can be present ?

On Escalation Ticket # 00412430 the Following Fields have been updated: 
Status has been changed to Awaiting R&D.

On Escalation Ticket # 00412430 the Following Fields have been updated: 
Status has been changed to Awaiting Escalating Engineer.

On Escalation Ticket # 00412430 the new comment has been added: Oana-Cristina Rus:

Hi @WaitingOnEngineer,


From our perspective, if the customer received the test email, the SMTP configuration is working correctly.

It’s possible that the customer did not set up the email settings correctly.
Please also check the Outlook quarantine.

The error "unable to qualify my own domain name" typically means that the system or mail server cannot determine its fully qualified domain name (FQDN). This usually happens due to misconfigured hostname settings.

Receiving the email from "root@eppserver" it's normal behavior. The service used to send email is one from the system and by default, when the message is received, the FROM email address will appear as your user@server. In our case, root@eppserver.

You can also share the test email that the customer received with us.
